name: The Woodlands Resort & Conference Center

reviews.text: This was our 2nd vist to the Woodlands Resort and once again we were not disappointed. It's a great place to relax and unwind. Once on the property you feel miles away from stress. We requested a Forest Lake room in the area we had stayed our previous visit and not only did they look it up but they noted the information on our reservation and made sure we got it down to the same building. All the staff were wonderful and I do mean ALL.
reviews.title: Great weekend
Great place to stay. Pool waterslide golf.
reviews.text: The Forest Lake rooms are away from the Oasis pool area. These rooms are so quiet and relaxing. Just what we were looking for. The pool area is a short walk and we certainly did not see it as an inconvience. I also have to say that the Forest Lake rooms seemed sound proof. Our group had a total or 5 rooms for the weekend, 4 being in the Forest Lake area and I never heard a sound from the other rooms and we had friends next door that I know can be loud. I wouldn't recommend these rooms to families but that's only because the Oasis pool area is where the children in our group wanted to be and the pool area is across the main road leading into the Resort.
The Cafe by the pool makes an excellent burger.
reviews.title: A true resort experience close to home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The disappointments were that you have a $10 charge for internet and you have to ask for a refrigeration.
reviews.title: Nice resort and the Oasis pool was awesome! To bad internet service is $10 for the price of the room per night...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm sure we will stay again.
reviews.title: Not Worth The Money

reviews.text: The pool that once was (and maybe still is ) the adult pool was over run with children and young teens. The taxi service that the hotel recommended charged $20 for a three mile ride.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a positive note, the room was clean and well-appointed and the the burger at the poolside bar was very good!
reviews.title: I try to go at least 2 to 3 times a year for the weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I like to go to concerts at the Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavillion in Woodlands, Texas and always stay at the Woodlands Resort for the weekend. I have never been dissapointed with it. I always request a Lake Forest Room when I make reservations because I find it a little more tranquil. It's away from the main pool, which is totally amazing in it's own right, but there is a smaller pool, with not as many ammenities as the larger one. It is the only place I stay when I'm in the area, whether I'm with my husband or a "girlfriend getaways". Check it out online.
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend - Spa and Golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. We had the least expensive room but it was awesome. Secluded from the hustle and bustle of the resort with the patio facing onto a quiet pond. Huge room with the best hotel shower I can remember in the last 20 years. This is an older sprawling conference hotel but it has been very well maintained and the sprawl is what makes it special.
reviews.title: We will be back.

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and the staff is very friendly.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort except for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furniture is from 1970'S with wood barrel bases and formica tops. For Real!!! The sofa had stains from who knows what. All this for only $169 Per Night. The setting was nice - The room and decor you can keep.
reviews.title: IF YOU WANT 70'S RETRO THIS IS THE PLACE

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel, as the rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The room service was excellent as was the service in all the restaurants.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel, facilities excellent, warm friendly reception.

reviews.text: Idea place to for all, 2 excellent golf courses as well as good practice facilities which are free. Excellent spa facilities to use after playing golf, tennis, hiking or cycling.
reviews.title: Nice conference hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent shopping malls close by. Greeting and service from all staff members was excellent,
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Getaway Close to Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkin was fast and friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful Woodlands Weekend Getaway Close to Houston Home

reviews.text: My daughter loved the fact that we can go anywhere in the resort with a golf cart. The place is so beautiful and relaxing. The breakfast buffet is great, we enjoyed it. We stayed in FIR cottage, we love the bi level suite, carpet probably needs to be change? I had to call for the microwave, but they brought it right away. The whole room looks nice but looks old...like I said just need new carpet and toilet bowls (they move when you use it)....but all in all we enjoyed it....we will come back....Better signage...needs free wi fi at least...
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.text: We traveled here for Spring Break so our son could enjoy the heated pool & spring break activities. First of all there were no spring break activities during the week and the pool was barely heated, plus the poolside cafe shut down at 5 pm. I was very disappointed.
reviews.title: I was not impressed!

reviews.text: Our room was in the "older section" Basil Briar with a lame view of the parking lot, old dated 70's furniture with an AC that sounded like an old car when it turned on. It woke me up all night. Finally on the 2nd night I had to switch it to fan to drown out the noise and get a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Great family "staycation"

reviews.text: The restaurant service was horrible, after being seated by the hostess we waited 15 mins for a waiter, who never showed up. We had to go back to the hostess to find someone to help us. The water on our table was old and had been there for who knows how long because it had melted and water was pooling all over the table, the silverware was dirty and the tables around us were never bussed and full of old food. We almost left but our son wanted to stay to eat pizza.
reviews.title: Loved it, but...

reviews.text: The business center was very disappointing. We bought tickets online for the Space Center and all we needed to do was print a receipt to take with us. We had to swipe our credit card to use the computer and the computer was super slow charging us $15 just to log onto our email and print 1 single page of paper. We had to call customer support to ask why it was taking 15 minutes to load a single page, they told us to use a different computer but we still were getting charged per minute. Plus we had to pay for the paper that was printed. A quick run in and run out turned into an half an hour ordeal and they refused to give us a credit for using slow computers. What a joke.
reviews.title: Bring earplugs

aka: The Woodlands Resort And Conference Center
description: Nestled in 28,000 acres of forest north of Houston, The Woodlands Resort is a destination of fun and relaxation. Just steps from 440 deluxe guest rooms are two championship golf courses and the Forest Oasis Waterscape™. Guests enjoy seasonal poolside dining, dive-in movies and family-friendly entertainment. Other resort amenities include a full-service spa and fitness facility, 180 miles of trails, and tennis courts. Explore the property’s three restaurants or lounge, plus nearby shopping and entertainment.
